alert.note: Alert for Sweet Grass (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 26 at 6:20PM MDT until further notice by NWS Billings
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of south central Montana, including the following county, Sweet Grass. * WHEN...Until 800 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 617 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain has fallen. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Simmons Creek, Cherry Creek, Hamilton Creek, Sourdough Creek, Carson Creek, Sweet Grass Creek, Wildcat Creek and Otter Creek. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... mainly rural areas of North Central Sweet Grass County - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
